meanings.sent1: After making a mistake, I had to reset the puzzle to start over.
meanings.sent2: I reset my alarm clock to wake me up earlier tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally reset the game, and now all my progress is gone!
meanings.sent4: She reset her goals for the year to focus on self-improvement.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to reset the engine to fix the car's performance issues.

meanings.definition: To restore to a previous condition or state
meanings.sent1: The IT technician had to reset the computer to its factory settings.
meanings.sent2: I reset the room to its original layout after the party.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly tried to reset the clock to go back in time.
meanings.sent4: The artist reset the painting to its initial sketch to make changes.
meanings.sent5: The magician reset the trick to perform it flawlessly for the audience.
